New Records: Cape Verde became the first team to qualify for the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations last-16 stage after defeating Mozambique with a 2-0 scoreline.
Key Match Events: Bebe scored a 40-yard free kick that goalkeeper Ernan Siluane should have saved
Ryan Mendes took advantage of a defensive lapse to double their lead
Kevin Pina hammered a brilliant strike into the top corner from outside the box
Geny Catamo had a penalty overturned by VAR and hit the crossbar with a free kick.
Pre-Game Insights: Cape Verde, ranked 73rd in the world, were expected to face a tough group containing Egypt and Ghana, but they pulled off a stunning victory.
The match was Cape Verde's fourth Africa Cup of Nations appearance, having advanced from the group stage in three of them.
Post-Match Reflections: Cape Verde secured top spot in Group B with one game remaining, setting up a clash against a third-place finisher from another group in the round of 16.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cape Verde's victory marked their first time qualifying for the last-16 stage in the Africa Cup of Nations.
The match saw key moments including a VAR-overturned penalty and a late save by Geny Catamo.
